creator: rmcguigan@mozilla.com

cc_detail.name: MattN+bmo@mozilla.com
cc_detail.real_name: Matthew N. [:MattN] (PM if requests are blocking you)

comments.text:
Summary: With an investigation on dataloss for users in the forum, one of the general categories is that users are not finding their logins or passwords after they update to Firefox 56. Regression window is 55 -> 56.0.2 roughly. (they do not have 3rd party password managers or mention issues with sync)

Note: I am still waiting on more information on the fix for the two users that rebooting fixed the issue. 


Examples: 
https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1182030
After update passwords gone https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1178196 
https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1178577 

Reboot/update 
https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1179324 

After update password gond https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1179731
https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1183222#answer-1025148 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1183328#answer-1025807 - waiting on an update

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1183565#answer-1025812 - solved by reboot, waiting on more details
comments.author: rmcguigan@mozilla.com

comments.text: Thanks Rachel. It would be great if you could ask some of the responsive/future reporters to paste what is in the "browser console" - I suspect there might be some error relating to the password manager.
comments.author: markh@mozilla.com

comments.text:
From my first impression it's not clear to me that there's a pattern or anything uncommon here:
* some of the users are talking about losing passwords after a Fx Refresh
* some of the user are talking about losing passwords and not mentioning a refresh
* one user seemed to be talking about a single site (Paypal) and was probably hitting bug 1322673 (which really should get resourced) when they talked about it not updating.

On every version update there is a handful of people saying they lose all their passwords and we've yet to see a pattern (e.g. bug 1387331).
comments.author: MattN+bmo@mozilla.com

comments.text:
(In reply to Matthew N. [:MattN] (PM if requests are blocking you) from comment #2)
> From my first impression it's not clear to me that there's a pattern or
> anything uncommon here:

FWIW, I ended up running an analysis of sync telemetry from submissions over the last 200 days, to try and see if there does seem to be a trend upwards and couldn't identify anything. IOW, I can't see evidence that 56 or any other version is over represented, nor that there is a spike as new releases go out. IOW2, I guess I need to agree with Matt's comment.

https://gist.github.com/mhammond/77af60618b3ed3e9cb7abde6f0a69d26

(you probably want to "view image" to see the graph in all its glory)
comments.author: markh@mozilla.com

comments.text:
¡Hola!

FWIW https://support.mozilla.org/es/questions/1185364 claims to have lost passwords upon upgrade.

¡Gracias!
Alex
comments.author: alex_mayorga@yahoo.com

comments.text: Marking as incomplete until there's confirmation that it's still trending.
comments.author: MattN+bmo@mozilla.com

comments.text: Yep, no more issues there. Thank you for taking a look!
comments.author: rmcguigan@mozilla.com

assigned_to_detail.real_name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

summary: [SUMO User Trending issue] After Firefox 56 users are mentioning losing their passwords
